des: "This is a traditional Jewish food that is served for Sabbath lunch. Its origin is unknown, but it has been traced back to the early 1200's! You can leave it overnight- the longer it cooks for the better it tastes!"
ins: Combine the beef brisket, potatoes, kidney beans, barley, onion, garlic, honey, ketchup, barbeque sauce, soy sauce, onion soup mix, salt, pepper, and paprika in a 6-quart slow cooker.  Cook on High for 1 hour. Then, turn to Low and continue cooking for another 7 hours.
